noun.description: A gentle sheen or soft glow, especially that of a partly reflective surface.
examples: the luster of the Milky Way
she couldn't eat and her hair lost its luster

noun.description: A thin coating containing unoxidized metal which gives an iridescent glaze to ceramics.
A fabric or yarn with a sheen or gloss.
A prismatic glass pendant on a chandelier or other ornament.

origin: Early 16th century: from French, from Italian lustro, from the verb lustrare, from Latin lustrare illuminate.
